result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael Wayne Lengling was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 41 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine, Surcharge and Fee to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $100.00 per month starting the 3rd month of release onto Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $60.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Butler Police Department.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Take a Cognitive Thinking Course.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with establishments with primary business serves alcohol.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Count #1 was Dismissed.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
